body_html:
Unfortunately Bazel doesn't support Android on Windows yet -- see roadmap.

We're working on a full gradle/cmake/makefile solution that will work on Windows, but until then you can use the prebuilt libs and just drop libtensorflow_demo.so and libtensorflow_inference.so into your app.
body_text:
Unfortunately Bazel doesn't support Android on Windows yet -- see roadmap.
We're working on a full gradle/cmake/makefile solution that will work on Windows, but until then you can use the prebuilt libs and just drop libtensorflow_demo.so and libtensorflow_inference.so into your app.
body:
Unfortunately Bazel doesn't support Android on Windows yet -- see [roadmap](https://bazel.build/roadmap.html).

We're working on a full gradle/cmake/makefile solution that will work on Windows, but until then you can use the [prebuilt libs](https://ci.tensorflow.org/view/Nightly/job/nightly-android/) and just drop libtensorflow_demo.so and libtensorflow_inference.so into your app.
